newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thais detain American woman with 3.6 kgs of heroin.
newsitem.headline: Thais detain American woman with 3.6 kgs of heroin.

text.p: Thai anti-narcotics police said on Tuesday they had detained an American woman on suspicion of possessing about 3.6 kgs (7.9 lbs) of heroin for export.

Police alleged that Lisa Ann Padilla, 26, was carrying a suitcase with two plastic bags of heroin stashed inside when she was stopped at the departure lounge of Bangkok's Don Muang airport around midnight on Monday.
Police estimated the Thai price of the seized heroin at 2.54 million baht ($100,000) but said it could fetch 10 times more overseas.
The American could face a death sentence if convicted although a Thai court normally commutes such a penalty to a long jail term.
Police said they were holding Padilla pending a formal charge in court of illegal possession of narcotics for trafficking and export. It was not immediately known how she would plead in court.
Padilla told police she was resident of Upland, California.
